Case reference: 2005001099.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2004, an unidentified woman was discovered in a red 2004 Toyota Corolla under the Highway 400 Bridge on Highway 401 in Toronto, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this female to be from the Americas, South Asia, or Mixed Americas.

Case reference: 2014006340.CaseDesc: On January 16, 2002 Anatoli Dibrov went out in the evening for about 1/2 hour. When he came home he appeared secretive. Mr. Dibrov went to bed that evening and that was the last time he was seen. Originally from Russia, it's possible he may have returned.

Case reference: 2020007348.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1971, Liliam Alvarado was seen for the last time as she left her hotel room in Toronto, Ontario. Liliam left the hotel without her belongings.

Case reference: 2014005318.CaseDesc: In November of 1983, Tony Spalancin was seen for the last time leaving his place of employment in Drayton Valley, Alberta. It is believed that Tony travelled to Calgary, Alberta, to seek new employment. His vehicle was later located in Calgary.

Case reference: 2013000088.CaseDesc: On February 19, 1973, Pierre Gariepy was seen for the last time in the Plateau-Mont-Royal district of Montreal, Quebec. Pierre is manic-depressive and was frequently hospitalized.

Case reference: 2006011899.CaseDesc: Mr. McKay was last seen outside "Clarkes Tavern" in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on December 22, 1987.

Case reference: 2014004725.CaseDesc: Jack Ford was last seen on September 20, 1991. His abandoned vehicle was located by hunters on a cut line near Cold Lake on September 21 or 28 of 1991. Mr. Ford was reported missing October 16, 1991 by his son.

Case reference: 2008009598.CaseDesc: Mario Palermo was reported missing on January 20, 1978, by his mother. At that time, Mr. Palermo was living at home and was single. The last contact family members had with him was on January 8, 1978 when his mother received a Grey Coach parcel sent from Orillia which contained a pair of boots that he had borrowed from his brother and two boxes of chocolates.

Case reference: 2021059908.CaseDesc: On June 16, 2016, the partial remains of an unidentified man were recovered in Renews, Newfoundland. Between 2016 and 2018, additional remains belonging to this man were recovered.

Case reference: 2016061093.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1972, a female was found in Lake Erie, west of the Colchester light, east of the Detroit Channel, near the Town of Colchester, Ontario. Her post-mortem weight was recorded as being 170-180 lbs however, this measurement may not represent her actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. She is believed to have been dead for 1-5 weeks.

Case reference: 2011002399.CaseDesc: Cynthia Sunga was last seen at her family home on Donald street, on or about August 25, 2005.  She was reported missing to the Ottawa Police on November 11, 2005, by a family member.  She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001165.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2005, the body of an adult male was recovered from the lower Niagara River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 174 lbs and his length was measured at 5'6", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His teeth are stained suggesting that he may have been a smoker. He is circumcised and his appendix is present. He was not wearing any clothing or jewelry. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days prior to his recovery.

Case reference: 2014003825.CaseDesc: Ruby Ann Hardy was reported missing by her brother in 2002. She was last seen in the downtown east side of Vancouver in June 1997, and was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2006022899.CaseDesc: Eric  Schoenleber was last seen while fishing in a canoe on Innes Lake on May 16, 1972.

Case reference: 2014005303.CaseDesc: On November 7th, 2008, Van Do was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Mr. Do had indicated that he was intending to travel to Kitchener, Ontario to visit his friends. His wallet, bankcards and a packed suitcase were found in his home.

Case reference: 2015015560.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2015, Misty Faith Potts, from the Alexis Nakota Sioux First Nation, was seen for the last time when she had been left at the side of the road to walk a short distance home.

Case reference: 2017029343.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2017, Patrick Wall was last seen at his home in Wetaskiwin County, Alberta. His abandoned vehicle was located in Edmonton, also in Alberta.

Case reference: 2013000139.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Clayton Condos. He was last seen on March 20, 2006, in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014007309.CaseDesc: On August 20, 1997, a canoeist found a human skull on the Moose Jaw River, just south of Moose Jaw, SK. The skull was examined by the University Of Saskatchewan Department Of Archaeology. It was determined the skull had been exposed to the elements for 50 to 100 years. It was that of a 12 year old, possibly Caucasian, female. This case is being investigated by the Office of the Chief Coroner and the Royal Canadian Mounted Police.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2020008549.CaseDesc: On March 26, 1976, at approximately 12:30pm, Licelia D’Costa was last seen by her landlady in Toronto, Ontario. Licelia had told her roommate that she was headed to Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006015899.CaseDesc: Pamela Holopainen was last seen in the city of Timmins, Ontario in the early morning hours of December 14, 2003, following a house party.

Case reference: 2014002474.CaseDesc: Kenley Matheson was a student at Acadia University, Wolfville, Nova Scotia in September 1992. On September 21st it was reported that he was seen by a friend walking on Main Street in Wolfville, N.S. This was the last time anyone has seen or heard from Kenley Matheson.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014005574.CaseDesc: Judy Chescue was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in October 1988.  Judy was last seen near her home in Edmonton in July 1988.

Case reference: 2014003849.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1998, Jocelyne Boardman was seen for the last time when she left a friend's residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec, to return to her home in Kingston, Ontario. Jocelyne is known to only wear black clothing and she hasn't been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001907.CaseDesc: Mary Rose Keadjuk was residing at the Gold Range Hotel in Yellowknife, NWT. When she went missing, her personal belongings were found left behind, including her glasses which she relied upon. Mary Rose may have been pregnant at the time of her disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000103.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1969,  three commercial fishermen sold their catch, purchased groceries and departed Jackpine Island for Brochet via Reindeer Lake. Mr. Bighetty left in his own canoe and was ahead of two other men who were also travelling by canoe. The second canoe later had mechanical problems and had to stop on an island. The two men indicated that they had heard the other canoe and figured it was Mr. Bighetty coming back to look for them. However, they never saw him again. Mr. Bighetty's canoe was located in the lake in a vertical position 9.6 kilometers south of Brochet. It is presumed he drowned and no foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2020011563.CaseDesc: On July 17, 1988, at approximately 12:00pm, Mosses Korman was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008006798.CaseDesc: Jason Russell was last seen at the Casino in Niagara Falls. Mr. Russell was a student at Brock University in St. Catharines, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005223.CaseDesc: On March 4th, 2009, Wesley Foulds , 52, left his Abbotsford residence for an appointment in New Westminster.  Mr. Foulds didn't arrive for his appointment, and didn't show up for work later that day.  Mr. Foulds' vehicle was discovered the next day parked near the Hayward Dam in Mission BC.

Case reference: 2014005958.CaseDesc: Dallas Broich was last seen at his residence in Edmonton, Alberta, on October 8, 2012. He was supposed to report for work in Fort McMurray, Alberta, the following day but never arrived. Dallas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014005762.CaseDesc: On April 25, 2011, Yuji Fujita was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Yuji had called in sick to work on April 26 and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2016061106.CaseDesc: On November 1, 2006, the partial remains of a male were recovered from the Jordan Creek by a local resident who was dismantling a beaver dam on Old Hastings Road, in Centre Hastings, which is located North of Belleville, Ontario. The remains are believed to have been there at least 5 to 10 years and likely many more.

Case reference: 2014005024.CaseDesc: On November 16, 2007, Pierre Landry was seen for the last time in the area of Saint-Joseph-de-Beauce, Quebec. Pierre would have left his residence on foot and there are no indications in the direction he would have taken.

Case reference: 2019059679.CaseDesc: On January 14, 2017, the skeletal remains of an older man were found in a homeless encampment along Grandview Highway in Vancouver, British Columbia. It is estimated that he may have died several months prior to the discovery of his remains. Residents claimed that he had been there for several years, and went by the name Gordon. He was a small man, who had fractured his nose at some point in his past, and was known to eat a lot of Cheddar Jalapeno Cheetos.

Case reference: 2013000025.CaseDesc: On May 28, 1998, Darwin Sylvester was seen for the last time at approximately 23:00 hrs. He called his girlfriend shortly after midnight on May 29th. Mr. Sylvester had plans to meet with an associate for breakfast, however he never showed for the meeting. His belongings and luggage were all located at the residence on Chalmers. He has not had any contact with friends or family since.

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2016069642.CaseDesc: On April 21, 1995, the remains of a woman were discovered near Carbon, Alberta. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 10 and 15 years. The individual had dental restorations including stainless steel crowns.

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020017934.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Lebohang Nicol was seen for the last time in the area of 600 University Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Lebohang is also known to go by the first name of “Toby.” He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2012020021.CaseDesc: Madison Scott went missing in 2011. She was at a party in the early morning hours of May 28th at Hogsback Lake, and was to camp there overnight. In the morning her friends found her tent and her pickup truck, but Maddy was nowhere to be found. Her purse was found in the truck but her phone and keys were missing. When Maddy didn't return home her parents became worried and reported her missing.

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2012020036.CaseDesc: Monique Mattar has not been seen since April 20, 2009. She was known to lead a high risk lifestyle. Police investigations in regards to the whereabouts of Monique Mattar are ongoing.

Case reference: 2012020655.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2008, Wilson Grant Nokohoot was seen for the last time on the 1800 block of Smith Street, Regina, Saskatchewan. It is unusual for Mr. Nokohoot to not have regular contact with family and acquaintances.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2008006699.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1967, Stanley Sczcygiel was fishing on the Berens River with two other Americans.  All three were swept over the falls.  The other two men survived, however Mr. Sczcygiel is presumed to have drowned.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2008003999.CaseDesc: Bernard Champagne was last seen on July 10, 1997.  He was a bachelor and lived alone for 40 years in a cabin with no running water or electricity, located behind the Rodrigue residence.  Richard Rodrigue was concerned that night had fallen and Mr. Champagne had not returned to his cabin.  Mr. Rodrigue contacted the police and a search by canine, helicopter, and E.R.T. was conducted but proved unsuccessful in locating Mr. Champagne.

Case reference: 2015066612.CaseDesc: On December 7, 2015, Sheree Fertuck was seen for the last time driving a red 1998 International semi truck and trailer near Kenaston, Saskatchewan. The following morning her semi was located with several personal items inside it, including her cellular phone, keys and jacket.

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.

Case reference: 2014002241.CaseDesc: In April of 1972, Velma Marie Duncan was last seen by her brother hitchhiking from the Gang Ranch area to Williams Lake, BC. Ms. Duncan arrived at her sister’s residence and attended the downtown core of Williams Lake with her sister on May 3rd or 4th, 1972. Ms. Duncan entered a local bar, which was the last time she was seen.

Case reference: 2018063001.CaseDesc: On March 10, 1995, at around midnight, Ying Zhu was last seen by her boyfriend when he dropped her off at her home in Toronto, Ontario. The following day, her boyfriend arrived at Ying’s work to pick her up and found out that she had quit her job the previous week.

Case reference: 2014004353.CaseDesc: On June 23, 2002 RCMP received a call reporting a missing person in the Village of Makinak. Reported missing was George Turnbull, 82 years old. George was last seen on June 22, 2002 at approximately 8:00 pm by a home care worker and was last spoken to on the phone by his son at approximately 10:00 pm that same day. The home care worker arrived at approximately 9:00 am on June 23, 2002 and noticed at that time George was not in his residence. At approximately 10:00 am the family began to search in and around the area of George's residence and farm yard. He suffers from mild dementia and has wandered off before. Volunteers continued to search for him until June 26, 2002 at which point the search was called off. George Turnbull was not seen again.

Case reference: 2013000038.CaseDesc: Samuel Lachance was last seen at the Beverage Room in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan near the end of July, 1987. Samuel was in very good physical condition at the time of his disappearance and worked in different logging camps in Saskatchewan. Family members say that it was unusual for Samuel not to have any contact with them or his friends near the time he was last seen.

Case reference: 2014001392.CaseDesc: On March 31, 1994, Kuldip Singh was seen for the last time in Brampton, Ontario.  There is a possibility that Mr. Singh may be in the United States.

Case reference: 2018040713.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1996, at approximately 7:30am, William Chan was last seen when he dropped off his son at school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2021000851.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Kyle Leblanc was seen for the last time when he left his residence in Saint John, New Brunswick. Kyle was engaged in a high risk lifestyle.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2012020001.CaseDesc: Todd Beeching has been missing since mid 2005 although it wasn't reported until May 27, 2011.  He is believed to have been last seen in the Midway, BC area.

Case reference: 2014001558.CaseDesc: Mr. Cochrane was reported missing when his family expressed concern over his absence, as he had a history of memory loss and in the past ran into the bush and/or wandered off. An intensive land search was met with negative results. A set of footprints was found leading into the water of the river and an intensive operation involving drilling 10 holes through the ice in the area failed to turn up any evidence. The whereabouts of Mr. Cochrane remains unknown.

Case reference: 2014005703.CaseDesc: On September 25, 1964, Harold Jackman was seen for the last time at his farm in Shillington, Ontario. There is reason to believe that Mr. Jackman wandered away from his farm.

Case reference: 2013000095.CaseDesc: On October 19, 1969 Ronald Bonkowski went fishing with two friends in the Winnipeg River. Upon arriving at their desired location, the party anchored their boat in fast moving water. The anchor caught on the bottom of the river and pulled the boat down, causing it to over turn. All three men were thrown into the water. Two of the men were able to swim to the shore, however Mr. Bonkowski was observed going under the water. The over turned boat was found with an anchor line attached at the dam site. Searches were conducted by water and land, however Ronald Bonkowski was never located. He is presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2011002099.CaseDesc: On May 11, 2011, James Pratt attended his cottage property on Boulter Road in Hasting Highland. He said he was going to check on his trailer and outbuilding. On the afternoon of May 11th, a friend attended the Pratt property and found Mr. Pratt's car, but Mr. Pratt was not around. The friend returned on the 12th of May and discovered the car had not been moved. He searched the property for Mr. Pratt but he could not be found. Mr. Pratt has the reputation as a wanderer and it was not unusual for him to disappear for days at a time. This time however, he had left all of his belongings behind. The Bancroft OPP were notified on May 15th. A search was conducted but Mr. Pratt was not located. He suffers from medical problems including high blood pressure.

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2014004412.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1998, Mohammad Oloumi was last seen in Brampton.  It is believed that Mohammad may have travelled to an unknown destination in Asia.

Case reference: 2020008698.CaseDesc: On December 13, 1969, Helen Booth was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Helen had gone out with her boyfriend and he thought she was going to go home with a friend at 11:30pm.

Case reference: 2014003295.CaseDesc: Wayne Ronald Baker was reported missing on June 8, 1989 after not reporting to his shift at Phil's Restaurant in Banff, Alberta.  He was last seen by his roommate in staff accommodation the evening of June 7. Wayne Baker may have been seen in Edmonton at the Crest Hotel in July 1989.

Case reference: 2018022854.CaseDesc: Karrissa Koks was reported missing on April 30, 2018. However, she has not been seen or heard from by friends or family since October 7, 2017.

Case reference: 2014001859.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1997, Wendy Ratte was reported missing by her daughter. Mrs. Ratte was last seen on August 18, at 3pm. Her vehicle was found, locked, in a grocery store parking lot. Investigations led to a conviction in 2010, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2018027643.CaseDesc: On April 17, 2008, an unidentified man was discovered in Lake Ontario, near the Shoreview Place Beach in Stoney Creek, Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts he was of Sub-Saharan African ancestry.

Case reference: 2014001314.CaseDesc: On May 2, 1981, Verna Bjerky was seen for the last time hitchhiking from Hope to Kamloops, British Columbia. She was carrying roller skates over her shoulder and was seen getting into a vehicle with a lone occupant. Verna has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020032438.CaseDesc: On August 18, 2020, Jean-Louis Desrosiers was seen for the last time around noon at a business in the city of Gatineau, Quebec. He was driving a 2009 4-door grey Hyundai Elantra. Jean-Louis has not been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014003491.CaseDesc: On June 12th, 1981, Gordon Westover was seen at a local beer garden in Fort St John, BC at approximately 11:00 PM. Mr. Westover left the gathering in an unknown direction and has not been seen or heard from since. Mr. Westover has a mild mental disability and has been known to impersonate professional people such as police, firefighters, military and doctors. Mr. Westover told several people at the party that he was going to join the military, but no records show Mr. Westover was ever recruited. Mr. Westover has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2014002167.CaseDesc: On July 7th, 1973, Mr. Gorrie and his family were seen returning from a day of fishing on Cross Lake by the local RCMP patrol. Mr. Gorrie followed the patrol boat for some time and eventually the family boarded the patrol boat while Mr. Gorrie continued to follow in his boat. Both vessels proceeded west however after a time, the height of the waves increased (7 to 8 ft.). As a result the patrol boat had to increase power, which substantially increased the distance between the respective boats. Mr. Gorrie's boat was last seen a 1/2 mile behind the patrol. Immediate searches by air provided negative results. It is presumed that Mr. Gorrie drowned as he or the boat have never been located.

Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: Howard Graveline dissappeared from his home on décembre 29, 2011.  His car, passport and wallet were left behind.

Case reference: 2012003199.CaseDesc: In 1982, Lance Kunderman, age 22, left his home in Waterloo Region and headed to Banff, Alberta. Lance was reportedly in British Columbia in October 1982 and was to travel abroad. He was working with singer Eric Clapton's road crew. On December 26, 1982 Lance spoke with his family saying he was still with the band. Information was that Lance worked between Los Angeles and Vancouver. He was last seen in Vancouver, British Columbia in October 1982.

Case reference: 2018007092.CaseDesc: On February 8, 2018, at approximately 4:15pm, Wenting Liu was seen for the last time at Yorkdale Mall in Toronto, Ontario. Wenting was visiting Canada and failed to board her returning flight on February 10.

Case reference: 2012020116.CaseDesc: On April 1, 1975, Sylvie Ouimet left the Albert-Prevost institution, where she was hospitalized, without any of her personal effects. Her family has not heard from her since.

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton. Early the following morning, Amber made a post on social media, which she constantly used to communicate with family and friends. Her social media account had no further activity after this time. It is unknown when she left her residence, what she was last wearing or how she may have left. Amber did not have access to a vehicle and would typically use public transit to get around. She lived a high risk lifestyle and seemed despondent on the night she was last seen.

Case reference: 2015059300.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., Tommy Chear was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Tommy had advised that he would be home later, but never returned.

Case reference: 2014002578.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1979, Martin Corbet was seen for the last time as he went hunting in the woods.

Case reference: 2014003554.CaseDesc: On May 30, 1986, Edward Ludwig left his work site at Bow Valley Provincial Park, AB, to go boating on Lake Minnewanka in Banff National Park, AB.  Mr. Ludwig was despondent when he left.  His vehicle was located at Lake Minnewanka, AB and an unoccupied boat was found floating on the lake.

Case reference: 2014004386.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2003, Adolph Sewap was last seen in Sturgeon Landing near Creighton, Saskatchewan. Adolph had some medical issues and was known to travel to other communities.

Case reference: 2014002519.CaseDesc: Mr. Beauchamps was last seen on April 18, 1977 in Montreal. Mr.Beauchamps went to his sister's house after an argument with his boyfriend. He stayed there for a few days, and then left without giving any more news.

Case reference: 2020007459.CaseDesc: On June 24, 1981, Siew Oei was last seen as she left her apartment in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005760.CaseDesc: On December 23, 1992, Gaétan Rodier was last seen on his snow machine ice fishing on Lake Temiskaming in the District of Temiskaming, Ontario.  Subsequently, Gaetan’s snow machine had gone through the ice, and was recovered by divers, however, Gaétan was never located.

Case reference: 2005003899.CaseDesc: On September 5, 2001, a Caucasian male was found on a bench in an outhouse on a cross country ski trail in the Laurentian Hills, Deep River. He was well-tanned and had recently got a sunburn on his face. He was circumcised and his appendix was present. He is estimated to have been dead for two to three days. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this unidentified male is of European ancestry.

Case reference: 2006009499.CaseDesc: On February 23, 2003, Fred Takerer was reported missing by his son. Mr. Takerer had physical limits and was not able to get around easily. Police have not been able to locate Mr. Takerer and believe his disappearance to be suspicious.

Case reference: 2020008533.CaseDesc: On January 15, 1982, at approximately 7:30 am, Jona Rashid was last seen near 2275 Weston Road in Toronto, Ontario. Jona had called his sister in law at 5:30pm and stated that he would be coming over for dinner.

Case reference: 2008015199.CaseDesc: On September 28, 1978, Alison Mary Thomas was visiting her boyfriend in Toronto Ontario. Shortly after midnight she left his residence walking towards Yonge Street, Toronto. Alison Thomas had indicated that she was going to get a taxi cab to take her to her residence, but she never arrived. An extensive investigation was conducted by the Toronto Police Service, but to this day, Alison Thomas has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018063038.CaseDesc: On July 5, 1998, at approximately 12:00 p.m., Beverley Cole was last seen leaving her group home in Toronto, Ontario. Beverley had left with all of her personal belongings.

Case reference: 2016031589.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1978, a male was witnessed to jump in front of the subway train at Sherbourne Station in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'11", however, this measurement may not represent his actual height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present.

Case reference: 2014003349.CaseDesc: On March 14, 1993, Carl Berg Ellingsen was seen for the last time with his family at his residence in the East Vancouver region of British Columbia. Carl has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001848.CaseDesc: Laurie Baier was seen for the last time on April 27, 1977. Her vehicle was subsequently found abandoned on a forest road in Matagami, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014002147.CaseDesc: On September 22nd, 1981 Churchill RCMP received a call from Mrs. Esmoil advising her two sons, and two friends were late on returning from a canoe trip. On August 18th, 1981, Brian Dean Esmoil, his brother, and two friends headed out on an extended canoe trip from Leaf Rapids to Churchill. Numerous items, belonging to the men were found on shore. The bodies of three of the four travelers were recovered on the Churchilll River and death was due to drowning. The body of Brian Esmoil has never been recovered and it is presumed he drowned.

Case reference: 2018070168.CaseDesc: On November 7, 1986, the remains of a man were found near Floating Stone Lake in Alberta. This individual was deaf in their right ear. He had no upper teeth and likely wore an upper denture.

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.
